content:
Check:
  any:
    - name: --SPID
      operator: is_not_unique_set
      value: -"USUBJID"
Core:
  Id: CDISC.SENDIG.SEND157
  Version: '1'
  Status: Draft
Description: Raise an error when the mass identification is not unique within the
  subject, regardless of the mass location.
Outcome:
  Message: The mass identification is not unique within the subject regardless of
    the mass location.
  Output Variables:
    - --SPID
    - USUBJID
Rule Type: Record Data
Sensitivity: Variable
Authorities:
  - Organization: CDISC
    Standards:
      - Name: SENDIG
        Version: '3.0'
        References:
          - Origin: SENDIG Conformance Rules
            Rule Identifier:
              Id: '157'
              Version: '1'
            Version: '4'
            Citations:
              - Cited Guidance: The mass identification should be unique within the
                  subject, regardless of mass location.
                Document: SENDIG v3.0
                Section: 6.3.3
              - Cited Guidance: The mass identification should be unique within the
                  subject, regardless of mass location.
                Document: SENDIG v3.1
                Section: 6.3.3
              - Cited Guidance: The mass identification should be unique within the
                  subject, regardless of mass location.
                Document: SENDIG v3.1.1
                Section: 6.3.3
      - Name: SENDIG
        Version: '3.1'
        References:
          - Origin: SENDIG Conformance Rules
            Rule Identifier:
              Id: '157'
              Version: '1'
            Version: '4'
            Citations:
              - Cited Guidance: The mass identification should be unique within the
                  subject, regardless of mass location.
                Document: SENDIG v3.0
                Section: 6.3.3
              - Cited Guidance: The mass identification should be unique within the
                  subject, regardless of mass location.
                Document: SENDIG v3.1
                Section: 6.3.3
              - Cited Guidance: The mass identification should be unique within the
                  subject, regardless of mass location.
                Document: SENDIG v3.1.1
                Section: 6.3.3
      - Name: SENDIG-DART
        Version: v1.1
        References:
          - Origin: SENDIG Conformance Rules
            Rule Identifier:
              Id: '157'
              Version: '1'
            Version: '4'
            Citations:
              - Cited Guidance: The mass identification should be unique within the
                  subject, regardless of mass location.
                Document: SENDIG v3.0
                Section: 6.3.3
              - Cited Guidance: The mass identification should be unique within the
                  subject, regardless of mass location.
                Document: SENDIG v3.1
                Section: 6.3.3
              - Cited Guidance: The mass identification should be unique within the
                  subject, regardless of mass location.
                Document: SENDIG v3.1.1
                Section: 6.3.3
      - Name: SENDIG-DART
        Version: v1.2
        References:
          - Origin: SENDIG Conformance Rules
            Rule Identifier:
              Id: '157'
              Version: '1'
            Version: '4'
            Citations:
              - Cited Guidance: The mass identification should be unique within the
                  subject, regardless of mass location.
                Document: SENDIG v3.0
                Section: 6.3.3
              - Cited Guidance: The mass identification should be unique within the
                  subject, regardless of mass location.
                Document: SENDIG v3.1
                Section: 6.3.3
              - Cited Guidance: The mass identification should be unique within the
                  subject, regardless of mass location.
                Document: SENDIG v3.1.1
                Section: 6.3.3
      - Name: SENDID-GENETOX
        Version: v1.0
        References:
          - Origin: SENDIG Conformance Rules
            Rule Identifier:
              Id: '157'
              Version: '1'
            Version: '4'
            Citations:
              - Cited Guidance: The mass identification should be unique within the
                  subject, regardless of mass location.
                Document: SENDIG v3.0
                Section: 6.3.3
              - Cited Guidance: The mass identification should be unique within the

Scope:

    Include:
      - FINDINGS
  Domains:
    Include:
      - CL
      - PM
      - MA
      - MI
      - TF
